meanings.definition: Traveling from place to place, especially on foot.
meanings.sent1: The peregrinating hiker enjoyed the changing scenery along the trail.
meanings.sent2: The nomadic tribe led a peregrinating lifestyle, moving with the seasons.
meanings.sent3: The peregrinating squirrel kept finding its way back to the same tree.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like peregrinating clouds, drifting from one idea to another.
meanings.sent5: The peregrinating butterfly danced gracefully from flower to flower.

meanings.definition: To journey or travel from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: She was peregrinating through Europe, exploring new cities each week.
meanings.sent2: The migrating birds peregrinated south for the winter.
meanings.sent3: The lost dog was peregrinating around the neighborhood, searching for its home.
meanings.sent4: His mind peregrinated back to the memories of his childhood summers.
meanings.sent5: The river peregrinated through the valley, carving a path over centuries.
